intro: Globba bulbifera, commonly known as the bulbous globba, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are broad and sword-shaped, often reaching several feet in length. Globba bulbifera is primarily cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in local cultures.
